statements.name: PROC KDE
statements.description: The KDE procedure performs univariate and bivariate kernel density estimation. Statistical density estimation involves approximating a hypothesized probability density function from observed data. Kernel density estimation is a nonparametric technique for density estimation in which a known density function (the kernel) is averaged across the observed data points to create a smooth approximation. PROC KDE uses a Gaussian density as the kernel, and its assumed variance determines the smoothness of the resulting estimate. Refer to Silverman (1986) for a thorough review and discussion. † You can use PROC KDE to compute a variety of common statistics, including estimates of the percentiles of the hypothesized probability density function. You can produce a variety of plots, including univariate and bivariate histograms, plots of the kernel density estimates, and contour plots. You can also save kernel density estimates into SAS data sets.

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: Specifies the input SAS data set to be used by PROC KDE. The default is the most recently created data set.

statements.name: BIVAR
statements.description: The BIVAR statement computes bivariate kernel density estimates.

arguments.name: BIVSTATS
arguments.description: Produces a table for each density estimate containing the covariance and correlation between the two variables.

arguments.name: BWM=
arguments.description: Specifies the bandwidth multiplier applied to each variable in each kernel density estimate. The default value is 1.

arguments.name: GRIDL=
arguments.description: Specifies the lower grid limit applied to each variable in each kernel density estimate.

arguments.name: GRIDU=
arguments.description: Specifies the upper grid limit applied to each variable in each kernel density estimate.

arguments.name: LEVELS=
arguments.description: Requests a table of levels for contours of the bivariate density.

arguments.name: NGRID=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of grid points associated with each variable in each kernel density estimate.

arguments.name: NOPRINT
arguments.description: Suppresses output tables produced by the BIVAR statement.

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: Specifies the name of the output data set in which kernel density estimates are saved.

arguments.name: PERCENTILES=
arguments.description: Requests that a table of percentiles be computed for each BIVAR variable. You can specify a list of percentiles to be computed. The default percentiles are 0.5, 1, 2.5, 5, 10, 25, 50, 75, 90, 95, 97.5, 99, and 99.5.

arguments.name: PLOTS=
arguments.description: Requests one or more plots of the bivariate data and kernel density estimate. Syntax: (1) PLOTS=plot-request<(options)> | ALL | NONE (2) PLOTS=(plot-request<(options)> < plot-request<(options)>>)
arguments.help: PLOTS=ALL | CONTOUR | CONTOURSCATTER | HISTOGRAM | HISTSURFACE | NONE | SCATTER | SURFACE

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: Produces all bivariate plots.

arguments.name: CONTOUR
arguments.description: Produces a contour plot of the bivariate density estimate.

arguments.name: CONTOURSCATTER
arguments.description: Produces a contour plot of the bivariate density estimate overlaid with a scatter plot of the data.

arguments.name: HISTOGRAM
arguments.description: Syntax: HISTOGRAM <(ROTATE=angle TILT=angle)> Produces a bivariate histogram of the data. The following view-options can be specified: ROTATE=angle rotates the histogram angle degrees, where –180 < angle < 180. By default, angle = 54. TILT=angle tilts the histogram angle degrees, where –180 < angle < 180. By default, angle = 20.

arguments.name: HISTSURFACE
arguments.description: Syntax: HISTSURFACE <(view-options)> Produces a bivariate histogram of the data overlaid with a surface plot of the bivariate kernel density estimate. The following view-options can be specified: ROTATE=angle rotates the histogram and kernel density surface angle degrees, where –180 < angle < 180. By default, angle = 54. TILT=angle tilts the histogram and kernel density surface angle degrees, where –180 < angle < 180. By default, angle = 20.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: Suppresses all plots, including the contour plot that is produced by default when ODS Graphics is enabled and the PLOTS= option is not specified.

arguments.name: SCATTER
arguments.description: Produces a scatter plot of the data.

arguments.name: SURFACE
arguments.description: Syntax: SURFACE <(ROTATE=angle TILT=angle)> Produces a surface plot of the bivariate kernel density estimate. The following view-options can be specified: ROTATE=angle rotates the kernel density surface angle degrees, where –180 < angle < 180. By default, angle = 54. TILT=angle tilts the kernel density surface angle degrees, where –180 < angle < 180. By default, angle = 20

arguments.name: UNISTATS
arguments.description: Produces a table for each density estimate containing standard univariate statistics for each of the two variables and the bandwidths used to compute the kernel density estimate.

statements.name: BY
statements.description: You can specify a BY statement with PROC KDE to obtain separate analyses on observations in groups defined by the BY variables. When a BY statement appears, the procedure expects the input data set to be sorted in order of the BY variables.

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: Specifies that the observations are sorted in descending order by the variable that immediately follows the word DESCENDING in the BY statement.

arguments.name: NOTSORTED
arguments.description: Specifies that observations are not necessarily sorted in alphabetic or numeric order.

statements.name: FREQ
statements.description: The FREQ statement specifies a variable that provides frequencies for each observation in the DATA= data set.

statements.name: UNIVAR
statements.description: The UNIVAR statement computes univariate kernel density estimates.

arguments.name: BWM=
arguments.description: Specifies the bandwidth multiplier applied to each variable in each kernel density estimate. The default value is 1.

arguments.name: GRIDL=
arguments.description: Specifies the lower grid limit applied to each variable in each kernel density estimate.

arguments.name: GRIDU=
arguments.description: Specifies the upper grid limit applied to each variable in each kernel density estimate.

arguments.name: METHOD=
arguments.description: Specifies the method used to compute the bandwidth.

arguments.name: SJPI
arguments.description: Sheather-Jones plug-in

arguments.name: SNR
arguments.description: Simple normal reference

arguments.name: SNRQ
arguments.description: Simple normal reference that uses the interquartile range

arguments.name: SROT
arguments.description: Silverman’s rule of thumb

arguments.name: OS
arguments.description: Oversmoothed

arguments.name: NGRID=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of grid points associated with each variable in each kernel density estimate.

arguments.name: NOPRINT
arguments.description: Suppresses output tables produced by the BIVAR statement.

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: Specifies the name of the output data set in which kernel density estimates are saved.

arguments.name: PERCENTILES=
arguments.description: Requests that a table of percentiles be computed for each BIVAR variable. You can specify a list of percentiles to be computed. The default percentiles are 0.5, 1, 2.5, 5, 10, 25, 50, 75, 90, 95, 97.5, 99, and 99.5.

arguments.name: PLOTS=
arguments.description: Requests one or more plots of the bivariate data and kernel density estimate. Syntax: (1) PLOTS=plot-request<(options)> | ALL | NONE (2) PLOTS=(plot-request<(options)> < plot-request<(options)>>)
arguments.help: PLOTS=ALL | DENSITY | DENSITYOVERLAY | HISTDENSITY | HISTOGRAM | NONE

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: Produces all plots.

arguments.name: DENSITY
arguments.description: Univariate kernel density estimate curve.

arguments.name: DENSITYOVERLAY
arguments.description: Overlaid univariate kernel density estimate curves

arguments.name: HISTDENSITY
arguments.description: Univariate histogram of data overlaid with kernel density estimate curve

arguments.name: HISTOGRAM
arguments.description: Univariate histogram of data

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: Suppresses all plots

arguments.name: SJPIMAX=
arguments.description: Specifies the maximum grid value in determining the Sheather-Jones plug-in bandwidth. The default value is two times the oversmoothed estimate.

arguments.name: SJPIMIN=
arguments.description: Specifies the minimum grid value in determining the Sheather-Jones plug-in bandwidth. The default value is the maximum value divided by 18.

arguments.name: SJPINUM=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of grid values used in determining the Sheather-Jones plug-in bandwidth. The default is 21.

arguments.name: SJPITOL=
arguments.description: Specifies the tolerance for termination of the bisection algorithm used in computing the Sheather-Jones plug-in bandwidth. The default value is 0.001.

arguments.name: UNISTATS
arguments.description: Produces a table for each variable containing standard univariate statistics and the bandwidth used to compute its kernel density estimate.

statements.name: VAR
statements.description: The VAR statement supported by PROC KDE in SAS 8 and earlier releases is now obsolete. The VAR statement has been replaced by the UNIVAR and the BIVAR statements, which enable you to produce multiple kernel density estimates with a single invocation of the procedure.

statements.name: WEIGHT
statements.description: The WEIGHT statement specifies a variable that weights the observations in computing the kernel density estimate.
